Class FlowCamVirtualStackPlus

java.lang.Object
  ImagePlus
      FlowCamVirtualStackPlus

public class FlowCamVirtualStackPlus
extends ImagePlus

This convenience class will load and display a stack given a list of filenames. The stack will be a VirtualStack (only the visible slice is loaded).

Constructor Summary

          Construct an empty virtual stack.

public FlowCamVirtualStackPlus()
Construct an empty virtual stack.

FlowCamVirtualStackPlus

public FlowCamVirtualStackPlus(java.lang.String directory,
                               java.lang.String[] names,
                               boolean toByte)
Constructs a stack from a diretcory plus a String array of file names.

Parameters:
directory - the fully qualified path
files - A String array with filenames
toByte - If true all images in stack are converted to 8 bit, otherwse they are left in native format.

FlowCamVirtualStackPlus

public FlowCamVirtualStackPlus(java.lang.String directory,
                               java.lang.String[] names)
Constructs a stack from a diretcory plus a String array of file names. Files will be converted to 8-bit if required.

Parameters:
directory - the fully qualified path
files - A String array with filenames

FlowCamVirtualStackPlus

public FlowCamVirtualStackPlus(java.lang.String concat_files,
                               boolean toByte)
Constructs a stack from a String of absolute file paths concentanated with the "\n" newline character

Parameters:
concat_files - A single String with fully qualified filenames delimited with the newline character.
toByte - If true all images in stack are converted to 8 bit, otherwse they are left in native format.

FlowCamVirtualStackPlus

public FlowCamVirtualStackPlus(java.lang.String[] files,
                               boolean toByte)
Constructs a virtual stack from a String array of absolute file paths.

Parameters:
files - A String array with fully qualified filenames
toByte - If true all images in stack are converted to 8 bit, otherwse they are left in native format.
Method Detail

adjustToPadding

public int[] adjustToPadding(int x0,
                             int y0,
                             int w,
                             int h,
                             int pad)
Given x0, y-, width, height and pad generate a 4 element array of [left, top, width, height] such that the padding doesn't run off the edge

Parameters:
x0 - the starting coordinate
y0 - the starting coordinate
width - the width of the subset image (from x0 to right)
h - the height of the subset image (from y0 downward)
pad - the number of pixels to pad by in x and y
Returns:
a 4 element array of adjuested [x0, y0, width, height]

createSubsetProcessor

public ImageProcessor createSubsetProcessor(int x0,
                                            int y0,
                                            int w,
                                            int h,
                                            int pad)
A method for crafting a subimage ImageProcessor

Parameters:
x0 - the starting coordinate
y0 - the starting coordinate
width - the width of the subset image (from x0 to right)
h - the height of the subset image (from y0 downward)
pad - the number of pixels to pad by in x and y
Returns:
a subset processor of the specified coordinates with the grayscale values

createSubsetImagePlus

public ImagePlus createSubsetImagePlus(int x0,
                                       int y0,
                                       int w,
                                       int h,
                                       int pad)
A method for crafting a subimage ImagePlus

Parameters:
x0 - the starting coordinate
y0 - the starting coordinate
w - the width of the subset image (from x0 to right)
height - the height of the subset image (from y0 downward)
pad - the number of pixels to pad by in x and y
Returns:
a subset image of the specified coordinates with the grayscale values and calibration of the the original
